task.title: Adding a new target to the Ant build process
task.shortdesc: Use the Ant conductor extension point (dita.conductor.target.relative) to make new targets available to the Ant processing pipeline. This can be done as part of creating a new transformation, extending pre-processing, or simply to make new Ant targets available to other plug-ins.

step.cmd: Create an Ant project file that contains the new target.
In the same directory as the Ant project file, create a wrapper file that imports the Ant project file:
step.info: <dummy> <import file="Ant-file"/> </dummy>where Ant-file is the project file that contains the new target.

step.stepxmp:
<plugin id="plugin-id"> <feature extension="dita.conductor.target.relative" file="wrapper-file"/> </plugin>where:
plugin-id is the plug-in identifier, for example, com.example.ant.
wrapper-file is the wrapper file that imports the Ant project file.

result.p: The imports from wrapper file are copied into the build.xml file, using the correct path. This makes the new Ant targets available to other processes.
